title: Effective Group Formation and Seating Arrangement Strategies for Adult Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic group dynamics and adult learning principles
context.additional_context: Development of strategies considering the impact of learners' relational awareness on educational effectiveness.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze differences in peer relationship perceptions during group formation and develop strategies that reflect these insights.
Learners can maximize learning effectiveness by utilizing virtual seating arrangement techniques in online environments.
Learners can explain how to assess peer relationship perception accuracy by applying Signal Detection Theory (SDT).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
